text: Though many factors and dynamics stand out about this match, time was clearly the most important factor, first and foremost. Spanning almost 100 days, the individual games were often split into multi-day sprints. Could the way each player experienced time be a factor in the quality of their attention in Baguio? How exactly does time effect what each player sees or doesn’t see?

Neither player exhibited much brilliance when given such an extended opportunity to demonstrate their abilities. How did two fine specimens of Kasparov's “Drosophila of reasoning” become so consumed with fear and loathing in Baguio? A look back four years to game two of their Candidates Final in Moscow helps answer these questions.
